varstool.sa package¶

Submodules¶

varstool.sa.dvars_funcs module¶

varstool.sa.gvars_funcs module¶

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs module¶

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs.cov_section(pair_cols: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, mu_star: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function return the sectional covariogram of the pairs of function evaluations that resulted from each star point. This function is specific for the time-series varying/aggregate of the VARS sensitivity analysis.

Parameters

  • pair_cols (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of paired values function evaluations

  • mu_star (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas DataFrame of mu star values that are calculated separately

Return cov_section_values

the sectional covariogram dataframe

Rtype cov_section_values

pd.DataFrame

1

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Theory. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017558

2

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Application. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017559

Razavi, Saman, (2017): algorithm, code in MATLAB (c) Matott, Shawn, (2019): code in C/++ Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs.covariogram(pair_cols: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, mu_overall: pandas.core.series.Series) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function return the covariogram values derived from the pairs of function evaluations that each resulted from each star point. This function is specific for the time-series varying/aggregate of the VARS sensitivity analysis.

Parameters

  • pair_cols (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of paired values function evaluations

  • mu_overall (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of overall mu calculated on all function evaluation values for each time-step

Return covariogram_values

the covariogram dataframe

Rtype covariogram_values

pd.DataFrame

1

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Theory. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017558

2

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Application. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017559

Razavi, Saman, (2017): algorithm, code in MATLAB (c) Matott, Shawn, (2019): code in C/++ Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs.e_covariogram(cov_section_all: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function return the Expected value of covariogram values derived from the pairs of function evaluations that each resulted from each star point. This function is specific for the time-series varying/aggregate of the VARS sensitivity analysis.

Parameters

cov_section_all (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of sectional covariograms

Return e_covariogram_values

the covariogram dataframe

Rtype e_covariogram_values

pd.DataFrame

1

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Theory. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017558

2

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Application. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017559

Razavi, Saman, (2017): algorithm, code in MATLAB (c) Matott, Shawn, (2019): code in C/++ Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs.ivars(variogram_array: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, scale: float, delta_h: float) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Generates Integrated Variogram Across a Range of Scales (IVARS) by approximating area using right trapezoids having width of delta_h and hights of variogram values. This function is specific for the time-series varying/aggregate of the VARS sensitivity analysis.

Parameters

  • variogram_array (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of variogram values for each time-step

  • scale (float) – the scale for the IVARS evaluations

  • delta_h (float) – the resolution of star point generation

Return ivars_values

the Sobol Equivalent values

Rtype ivars_values

pd.DataFrame

1

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Theory. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017558

2

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Application. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017559

Razavi, Saman, (2017): algorithm, code in MATLAB (c) Matott, Shawn, (2019): code in C/++ Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs.morris_eq(pair_cols: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function return the Morris Equivalent values derived from the pairs of function evaluations that each resulted from each star point. This function is specific for the time-series varying/aggregate of the VARS sensitivity analysis.

Parameters

pair_cols (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of paired values function evaluations

Return morris_eq_values

the morris dataframe

Rtype morris_eq_values

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs.pairs_h(iterable) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function gives the pairs of numbers considering their differences.

Parameters

iterable (iterable) – an iterable object

Return pairs

the returned dataframe of paired values

Rtype pairs

pd.DataFrame

Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs.scale(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, bounds: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, axis: int = 1) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function scales the sampled matrix df to the bounds that is a defined via a dictionary with ub, lb keys; the values of the dictionary are lists of the upper and lower bounds of the parameters/variables/factors. if (axis = 1) then each row of df is selected, otherwise columns.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – a dataframe of randomly sampled values

  • bounds (dict) – a lower and upper bounds to scale the values

  • axis (int, optional) – 0 for index, 1 for columns

Return df

the returned dataframe scaled using bounds

Rtype df

pd.DataFrame

Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs.section_df(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, delta_h: float) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function gets the paired values of each section based on index.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – a dataframe of star points

  • delta_h (float) – resolution of star samples

Return sample

the paired values for each section of star points

Rtype sample

pd.DataFrame

Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

varstool.sa.tsvars_funcs.sobol_eq(gamma: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, ecov: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, variance: pandas.core.series.Series, delta_h: float) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function return the Sobol Equivalent values derived from the variogram (gamma), expected values of sectional covariograms (ecov), and overall variance (variance). This function is specific for the time-series varying/aggregate of the VARS sensitivity analysis.

Parameters

  • gamma (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of variogram values for each time-step

  • ecov (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas DataFrame of expected values of sectional covariograms for each time-step

  • variance (pd.Series) – variance of function evaluations over all time-steps

  • delta_h (float) – resolution of star samples

Return sobol_eq_values

the Sobol Equivalent values

Rtype sobol_eq_values

pd.DataFrame

1

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Theory. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017558

2

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Application. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017559

Razavi, Saman, (2017): algorithm, code in MATLAB (c) Matott, Shawn, (2019): code in C/++ Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

This function return the variogram calculated from the pairs of function evaluations that each resulted from each star point. This function is specific for the time-series varying/aggregate of the VARS sensitivity analysis.

Parameters

pair_cols (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of paired values function evaluations

Return variogram_values

varstool.sa.vars_funcs module¶

varstool.sa.vars_funcs.apply_unique(func: Callable, df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, axis: int = 1, progress: bool = False, *args: tuple, **kwargs: dict) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Applys func to unique rows (axis=1) or columns (axis=0) of df in order to increase the efficiency of func evaluations.

Parameters

  • func (Callable) – the function of interest to be applied to df

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – the Pandas DataFrame of interest

  • axis (int, optional) – 0 for index, 1 for columns

Return applied_df

the returned dataframe with the func evaluations

Rtype applied_df

pd.DataFrame

Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

varstool.sa.vars_funcs.bootstrapping(pair_df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, cov_section_all: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, bootstrap_size: int, bootstrap_ci: float, func: Callable, delta_h: float, ivars_scales: Tuple[float, …], parameters: Dict[Union[str, int], Tuple[float, float]], st_factor_ranking: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, ivars_factor_ranking: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, grouping_flag: bool, num_grps: int, progress: bool = False) → Tuple¶

varstool.sa.vars_funcs.elbow_method(z)¶
varstool.sa.vars_funcs.factor_grouping(sens_idx: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, num_grp: Optional[int] = None)¶
varstool.sa.vars_funcs.factor_ranking(factors)¶

Ranks factors based on their influence (how large or small results are) The lowest rank corresponds to the most influential (larger) factor

parameters: factors: an array like input that contains factors that are to be ranked

returns: a numpy array containing the ranks of each factor in their corresponding index

varstool.sa.vars_funcs.grouping(result_bs_ivars_df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, result_bs_sobol: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, result_bs_ivars_ranking: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, result_bs_sobol_ranking: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, num_grps: int, st_factor_ranking: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, ivars_factor_ranking: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, parameters: Dict[Union[str, int], Tuple[float, float]], bootstrap_size: int) → Tuple¶
varstool.sa.vars_funcs.ishigami(x: collections.abc.Iterable, a: int = 7, b: float = 0.05) → float¶

Ishigami test function

varstool.sa.vars_funcs.ivars(variogram_array: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, scale: float, delta_h: float) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Generates Integrated Variogram Across a Range of Scales (IVARS) by approximating area using right trapezoids having width of delta_h and hights of variogram values. This function is specific for the time-series varying/aggregate of the VARS sensitivity analysis.

Parameters

  • variogram_array (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of variogram values for each time-step

  • scale (float) – the scale for the IVARS evaluations

  • delta_h (float) – the resolution of star point generation

Return ivars_values

the Sobol Equivalent values

Rtype ivars_values

pd.DataFrame

1

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Theory. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017558

2

Razavi, S., & Gupta, H. V. (2016). A new framework for comprehensive, robust, and efficient global sensitivity analysis: 1. Application. Water Resources Research, 52(1), 423-439. doi: 10.1002/2015WR017559

varstool.sa.vars_funcs.scale(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, bounds: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, axis: int = 1) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function scales the sampled matrix df to the bounds that is a defined via a dictionary with ub, lb keys; the values of the dictionary are lists of the upper and lower bounds of the parameters/variables/factors. if (axis = 1) then each row of df is selected, otherwise columns.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – a dataframe of randomly sampled values

  • bounds (dict) – a lower and upper bounds to scale the values

  • axis (int, optional) – 0 for index, 1 for columns

Return df

the returned dataframe scaled using bounds

Rtype df

pd.DataFrame

Keshavarz, Kasra, (2021): code in Python 3 Blanchard, Cordell, (2021): code in Python 3

varstool.sa.vars_funcs.sobol_eq(gamma: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, ecov: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, variance: pandas.core.series.Series, delta_h: float) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

This function return the Sobol Equivalent values derived from the variogram (gamma), expected values of sectional covariograms (ecov), and overall variance (variance). This function is specific for the time-series varying/aggregate of the VARS sensitivity analysis.

Parameters

  • gamma (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas Dataframe of variogram values for each time-step

  • ecov (pd.DataFrame) – a Pandas DataFrame of expected values of sectional covariograms for each time-step

  • variance (pd.Series) – variance of function evaluations over all time-steps

Return sobol_eq_values

the Sobol Equivalent values
